benchmark_details.name: SMolInstruct
benchmark_details.overview: SMolInstruct is a large-scale instruction tuning dataset centering around small molecules. It contains 14 chemistry tasks and over 3 million rigorously curated samples, aiming to advance the performance of large language models (LLMs) in chemistry tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate research and applications in chemistry by providing a comprehensive dataset for instruction tuning of large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Despite high-quality curation, the dataset may still contain inaccuracies or be limited in assessing correctly generated descriptions or molecules.

data.source: Various sources including PubChem, MoleculeNet, and USPTO-full.
data.annotation: Curated and quality-controlled by experts and checks for molecular validity.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the proportion of correct predictions and structural similarities.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values for metrics like EM, Accuracy indicate better performance, while lower RMSE signifies improved predictions.
methodology.baseline_results: SoTA task-specific models outperform LlaSMol models on most tasks, but LlaSMol demonstrates notable improvements.
methodology.validation: Rigorous quality control applied during data collection and before model training.
